definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
as far as I know/to the best of my knowledge

sentences.english: Here is the best system for note-taking and studying I've discovered so far.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一种最佳的听课记笔记学习系统，据我所知。

sentences.english: The previously known most distant object was a short-lived gamma ray burst.
sentences.chinese: 之前所知最遥远的天体是一次短期的伽玛射线暴。

sentences.english: To my knowledge, Stanhope have rich experience in finance, law and planning etc.
sentences.chinese: 据我所知，他们在这方面都有丰富的经验。

sentences.english: To learn is a great virtue, but to be content with what one knows is stupid.
sentences.chinese: 学习是一个巨大的美德，但满足于所知的就是愚蠢了。

sentences.english: Based on what you know, which Next Gen Console will you buy?
sentences.chinese: 根据你现在所知，你会购买那一部次世代主机？

sentences.english: And as we all know, change is often slow and incremental.
sentences.chinese: 正如我们所知，变革往往是缓慢和渐进的。

sentences.english: I'm sure Marr's right that newspapers as we know them are not going to survive.
sentences.chinese: 我可以肯定马尔的正确，如我们所知报纸将不复存在。

sentences.english: Hurstwood knew nothing of the change of temper.
sentences.chinese: 赫斯渥对形势的这些变化一无所知。

sentences.english: As far as I know, none has been translated.
sentences.chinese: 据我所知，我的作品还没有波斯文译本。

sentences.english: To think, I could have lived all my life and missed it.
sentences.chinese: 想想看，我可能会活了一辈子而对此一无所知。

sentences.english: It is because you know nothing about it that I'll tell you from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 因为你对此事一无所知，所以我将对你从头说起。

sentences.english: In later years, Salinger become famous for not wanting to be famous, refusing interviews.
sentences.chinese: 晚年的塞林格却因为拒绝采访不愿出名而为世人所知。

sentences.english: He doesn't know even the ABCs of philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 他连哲学的基础知识都一无所知。

sentences.english: All have pros and cons, but all are valid solutions AFAIK.
sentences.chinese: 各有利弊，但都是有效的解决方案，据我所知。

sentences.english: The justiciars know nothing of Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 最高法官对爱尔兰情况一无所知。

sentences.english: "He didn't know anything about, " Cannavaro explained.
sentences.chinese: “对此他一无所知，”卡纳瓦罗解释到。

definition: as far as I know/to the best of my knowledge
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
to withhold information/to keep sth secret
